titlestmt.titleproper: A Finding Aid to the Nancy Douglas Bowditch and Brush Family papers, circa 1860-1985, in the Archives of American Art AAA.bowdnanc
Bowditch (Nancy Douglas) and Brush Family papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Jayna M. Hanson
titlestmt.sponsor: Funding for the processing and digitization of this collection was provided by the Terra Foundation for American Art

note.p: This finding aid is associated with MARC collection-level record. 208908

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-10-24T12:47-0400

did.unittitle: Nancy Douglas Bowditch and Brush family papers
did.abstract: The papers of painter, author, and designer Nancy Douglas Bowditch and the George de Forest Brush family measure 6.2 linear feet and date from circa 1860 to 1985. The majority of the collection consists of Bowditch's correspondence with family and friends and her notes and writings, particularly concerning her biography of her father George de Forest Brush The Joyous Painter, and her unpublished biography of her husband painter William Robert Pearmain. Brush family material includes scattered correspondence of George de Forest Brush and other family members, notes, sketches, clippings, and the family home building files, five scrapbooks, including two on William Robert Pearmain, and numerous photographs of the Brush family, Bowditch, and William Robert Pearmain. There is also correspondence between William Robert Pearmain and his family and artwork by Pearmin.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The Nancy Douglas Bowditch papers were donated to the Archives of American Art in several installments by Nancy Douglas Bowditch between 1968 and 1979. Bowditch's daughter, Mary A. Marlowe donated additional materials in 1982. In 2008, Joan Morgan, biographer of George de Forest Brush, donated additional papers she had acquired during her research.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Also among the collections at the Archives of American Art are the William Robert Pearmain and Pearmain family papers, 1888-1955, and an oral history with Nancy Douglas Bowditch conducted on January 30, 1974 by Robert F. Brown.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies note
altformavail.p: This site provides access to the papers of Nancy Douglas Bowditch in the Archives of American Art that were digitized in 2011, and total 9,056 images.
Generally, materials not scanned include duplicates, blank pages and versos, and drafts and edits of Nancy Douglas Bowditch's biography The Joyous Painter.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Portions of the collection were microfilmed in increments upon receipt on reels 2826-2831 and 3134; these reels are no longer in circulation. In 2011, all accessions were merged, including a small collection that was previously cataloged separately, and fully processed and described by Jayna Hanson and digitized in 2011 with funding provided by the Terra Foundation for American Art.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Nancy Douglas Bowditch and Brush family papers, circa 1860-1985. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Use of originals requires an appointment.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: The Nancy Douglas Bowditch and Brush family papers are owned by the Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution. Literary rights as possessed by the donor have been dedicated to public use for research, study, and scholarship. The collection is subject to all copyright laws.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Nancy Douglas Bowditch (1880-1979) worked primarily in the New Hampshire area as a painter, author, and costume and set designer. Bowditch's father was painter George de Forest Brush and she was first married to painter William Robert Pearmain, who died at an early age.

Nancy Douglas Bowditch was born to Mary and George de Forest Brush on July 4, 1880 in Paris, France. Along with her siblings Mary, Jane, Thea, Gerome, Tribbie, and Georgia, she often served as a subject of her father's paintings. The family lived in the artist colony of Dublin, New Hampshire where Nancy became close friends with their neighbor Samuel Clemens' (Mark Twain) daughter Jean Clemens.

Nancy met and became close to one of her father's pupils, William Robert Pearmain while traveling through Europe in 1907. Two years later, Nancy married Robert at the Brush family farm in Dublin, New Hampshire. Together, they had one daughter, Mary Alice whom they called Polly. Robert developed a strong political interest in growing anarchist movements, gave up painting and went to Pittsburgh to work in a factory. Shortly after, he became seriously ill and, upon the advice of a doctor, moved back to New Hampshire with Nancy. He soon died from leukemia in September 1912. In 1918, Nancy married her second husband Dr. Harold Bowditch from Boston, Massachusetts. With her second husband, Nancy had three more children, Martha, Henry, and George de Forest Bowditch.

Professionally, Nancy worked as a painter, wrote plays, and designed theatrical sets and costumes. In 1971, Bowditch published a biography of George de Forest Brush entitled The Joyous Painter. Nancy Douglas Bowditch died in 1979.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The papers of painter, author, and designer Nancy Douglas Bowditch and the George de Forest Brush family measure 6.2 linear feet and date from circa 1860 to 1985. The majority of the collection consists of Bowditch's correspondence with family and friends and her notes and writings, particularly concerning her biography of her father George de Forest Brush The Joyous Painter, and her unpublished biography of her husband painter William Robert Pearmain. Brush family material includes scattered correspondence of George de Forest Brush and other family members, notes, sketches, clippings, and the family home building files, five scrapbooks, including two on William Robert Pearmain, and numerous photographs of the Brush family, Bowditch, and William Robert Pearmain. There is also correspondence between William Robert Pearmain and his family and artwork by Pearmin.
Scattered family biographical materials include invitations, biographical sketches of George de Forest Brush, a ship's register, certificates, an obituary, and a sound recording of Nancy Bowditch.
Scattered personal business records include deeds of gift from various institutions and agreements from the publishing of The Joyous Painter.

One-third of the collection is correspondence with Nancy Douglas Bowditch, William Robert Pearmain, George de Forest Brush, and other members of the Brush, Pearmain, and Bowditch families. The majority of Nancy Douglas Bowditch's correspondence is from family and friends, although professional correspondence is also found. Nancy's notable correspondents include Jane Clemens, Barry Faulkner, Rockwell Kent, members of the Abbot Handerson Thayer family, and Nelson C. White. Also found are Nancy's letters to her first husband, William Robert Pearmain. Pearmain's correspondence includes letters from his parents, siblings, and his father-in-law, and a few letters from Pearmain to his family. George de Forest Brush's correspondence includes letters from friends and a few copies of letters written by Brush.

Writings and notes are primarily by Nancy Douglas Bowditch, the majority of which pertain to her biography of George de Forest Brush, The Joyous Painter, and her unpublished biography of William Robert Pearmain. Other writings are by George de Forest Brush, Tribbie Brush, Barry Faulkner, and William Robert Pearmain.
Artwork consists of approximately 78 drawings and sketches by William Robert Pearmain, 5 drawings and paintings by Nancy Bowditch, and one drawing by George de Forest Brush.
Brush family home and building files contain materials relating to a log cabin in New Hampshire, and the family home Brushwood which was built by William Robert Pearmain in 1911.

Five scrapbooks were compiled by members of the Brush, Pearmain, and Bowditch families. Two are about Pearmain, two are about George de Forest Brush, and one was organized by Harold Bowditch that contains family photographs.
Within printed materials are exhibition announcements and catalogs for George de Forest Brush, Barry Faulkner, Stephen Parrish, and Abbot Handerson Thayer.

Extensive photographs are of members of the Brush family, the Pearmain family, the Bowditch family, friends, and works of art by Bowditch, Brush, Pearmain and Douglas Volk. Included are portraits, snapshots, travel photos, wedding photos, and photos of the Brush family homes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged as 9 series:

list.item: Series 2: Personal Business and Financial Records, 1908-1974 (Box 1; 3 folders)
Series 4: Writings and Notes, circa 1900-1975 (Boxes 3-4; 1.0 linear feet)
Series 7: Brush Family Home Building Files, 1910-1971 (Boxes 4, 8, 10; 0.7 linear feet)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found are invitations to Nancy's and Robert Pearmain's wedding, American consolate registration cards pertaining to the Bowditch family (circa 1914), biographical sketches on George de Forest Brush, a portion of a ship's register that carried the Brush family to Europe, Polly Pearmain's wedding invitation, certificates from the International Correspondent School, an obituary for William Robert Pearmain, and a sound recording of Nancy speaking of her trip to Shelbyville, TN.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This series has been scanned in its entirety, except for the sound recording of Nancy Douglas Bowditch.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tapes runs approximately 11 minutes; Nancy speaks of George de Forest Brush and his relationships with his children, she reads a letter from Brush to a resident of Sheblyville in which the death of his mother is described.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of scattered personal business records that include deeds of gift from various institutions and agreements from the publishing of The Joyous Painter. Also found are scattered bills and a lease from 1911 signed by William Robert Pearmain.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This series has been scanned in its entirety.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found is the personal and professional correspondence of Nancy Douglas Bowditch, William Robert Pearmain, George de Forest Brush, and other members of the Brush, Bowditch and Pearmain families, including Harold Bowditch, Selma Bowditch, Mittie Taylor Whelpley Brush, Georgie Brush, Jane Brush, Mary Brush, Tribbie Brush, Mary Alice (Polly) Pearmain, and Jack Pearmain.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The series is arranged as 4 subseries:

list.item: Subseries 3.1: Nancy Douglas Bowditch Correspondence, circa 1900-1978
Subseries 3.3: George de Forest Brush Correspondence, 1895-1926

arrangement.p: This series has been scanned in its entirety.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The bulk of this subseries consists of the personal correspondence of Nancy Bowditch with her parents and parents-in-law, siblings, and first husband, William Robert Pearmain. Also found are letters from Jane Clemens, Barry Faulkner, and Gerald, Gladys, Emma, and Mary Thayer.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Correspondence is arranged alphabetically by correspondent, with the exception of professional correspondence relating to Nancy's book A Joyous Painter, which is arranged chronologically at the end of the subseries.
This subseries has been scanned in its entirety. Duplicates have not been scanned.

did.unittitle: Concerning Biography of George de Forest Brush
Concerning Biography of George de Forest Brush

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pearmain's correspondence is scattered and from family and friends.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Researchers should note that Pearmain's correspondence with Nancy Bowditch is arranged in Subseries 3.1.
This subseries has been scanned in its entirety.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: George de Forest Brush's correspondence is primarily with Brush and Pearmain family members and the Thayer family.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Researchers should note that Brush's correspondence with Nancy Brush is found in Subseries 3.1 and correspondence with William Robert Pearmain is found in Subseries 3.2. Correspondence is arranged alphabetically.
This subseries has been scanned in its entirety.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found are pieces of correspondence from members of the Bowditch, Brush, and Pearmain families.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Correspondence is arranged alphabetically.
This subseries has been scanned in its entirety.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The majority of this series consists of drafts, editing notes, and research notes for Nancy's biography of her father, The Joyous Painter. Also found are general notes and a typescript of a biography of William Robert Pearmain which contains original photographs of the Pearmain family. Writings by others are found in a separate subseries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The Writings and Notes series is arranged into 2 subseries:

list.item: Subseries 1: by Nancy Douglas Bowditch, circa 1910-1975

arrangement.p: This bulk of this series has been scanned.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains drafts, typescripts, edits, and notes for The Joyous Painter; a typescript for A Brief Biography of Robert Pearmain; a written recollecion of when Nancy and her siblings and friends sewed a new dress for her mother, Mittie Brush, with an accompaning photograph of the event; and various notes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The bulk of this series has been scanned. Some drafts, corrections, and proofs of The Joyous Painter have not been scanned.

unittitle.emph: A Brief Biography of Robert Pearmain, 1888-1912

did.unittitle: Notes on Samuel and Jane Clemens

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes notes written by George de Forest Brush, Trubbie Brush and Barry Faulkner; scattered writings by William Robert Pearmain; a song dedicated to the Brush family by Gerald "Gra" Thayer; and miscellaneous lists.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This subseries has been scanned in its entirety.

did.unittitle: Notes by George de Forest Brush
Lists of Works of Art by Brush

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Artwork is by Nancy Douglas Bowditch, William Robert Pearmain, and George de Forest Brush. Nancy Douglas Bowditch's work consists of one sketch, one study, and three completed drawings of William Robert Pearmain and Alan Seeger. Pearmain's artwork comprises twenty-four sketches including one watercolor, twelve studies, and forty-two completed drawings. Also found is one pencil sketch by Brush.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This series has been scanned in its entirety.

did.unittitle: George de Forest Brush, Pencil Sketch
William Robert Pearmain, Pencil Sketches and Drawings
William Robert Pearmain, Tempera and Oil Sketches

scopecontent.p: Scanned with Box 4, F24 and F25

did.unittitle: Oversized Sketches by William Robert Pearmain

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed materials include clippings, exhibition catalogs and announcements, calling cards, and other materials concerning Nancy Douglas Bowditch, George de Forest Brush, Barry Faulkner, Stephen Parrish, and Abbot Handerston Thayer.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This bulk of this series has been scanned.

did.unittitle: Articles Concerning George de Forest Brush
Files Kept by William Robert Pearmain
Reproductions of Artwork, by Nancy Douglas Bowditch
Reproductions of Artwork, by George de Forest Brush

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials relating to two homes of the Brush family: Brushwood, built by William Robert Pearmain, and a logcabin in Dublin, NH. Materials include plans, a map of Dublin, New Hampshire, Stave Church inspirations used by Pearmain to design the house, photographs, and a watercolor of Brushwood by Nancy.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This series has been scanned in its entirety.

did.unittitle: Watercolor of Brushwood, by Nancy Douglas Bowditch

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Oversized item scanned with Box 4, F53

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found are five scrapbooks compiled by members of the Brush, Pearmain, and Bowditch families. The majority of the albums consist of photographs and reproductions of works of art by George de Forest Brush and William Robert Pearmain. There are also photographs of exhibitions of Brush's art and of installations. One scrapbook contains family photographs organized by date by Harold Bowditch.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This series has been scanned in its entirety.

did.unittitle: Photographs of Works of Art by George de Forest Brush
Reproductions of Works of Art by George de Forest Brush
Scrapbook of Works of Art by William Robert Pearmain
Album of Exhibition of Works of Art by George de Forest Brush
Photograps of Works of Art and Installations
Oversized items from Harold Bowditch Scrapbook

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found are family photographs of the Brush family, snapshots, vacations, portraits, interiors, studios, buildings, pets and animals, family events, and of works of art. Among those photographed include George de Forest and Mittie Taylor Whelpley Brush and their children; Nancy Bowditch's children and grandchildren; the Pearmain family; the wedding of Clara Clemens with her father Samuel Clemens; and the Thayer children, their homes, and sleeping huts. A portrait of Nancy as a young woman was taken by Jean Clemens and has a love letter written by Robert Pearmain on verso. Also found are copies of photographs used in a biography of George de Forest Brush by Joan Morgan entitled George de Forest Brush, 1855-1941: Master of the American Renaissance (1985).

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The bulk of this series has been scanned. Photographs of works of art have not been scanned.
